name: Saoji/Savji (Spicy Fake Chicken Curry) Vegan.
description: Saji/Savji Tempeh (Spicy Fake Chicken Curry). A delicious and easy curry packed full of spices. Great for weeknights. Vegan and Gluten Free Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 3-4  Black peppercorns ((less or more depending on required spice))
2  Whole dry red chillies ((less or more according to spice))
1  stone flower ((Dagadphool, I didn't have this))
1 tablespoon Dry coconut (khopra Or Jowar flour(Sorghum))
1 cup chopped organic Tempeh ((can use Tofu or Seitan as well))

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan on medium heat, dry roast all the items under spices, continuously stirring) until they start turning slightly brown. (3-4 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan on medium heat, dry roast all the items under spices, continuously stirring) until they start turning slightly brown. (3-4 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Cool grind and keep if using for later.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool grind and keep if using for later.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, add in the oil and cook the onions until golden. Add in the coconut and ginger and cook for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In the same pan, add in the oil and cook the onions until golden. Add in the coconut and ginger and cook for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend the onion mixture with the spices and cilantro using a little water into a smooth paste. My blender conked out so the curry is not as smooth. In any which way, the curry is going to blow your mind away!
recipeInstructions.name: Blend the onion mixture with the spices and cilantro using a little water into a smooth paste. My blender conked out so the curry is not as smooth. In any which way, the curry is going to blow your mind away!

recipeInstructions.text: In the pan, add butter and the blended mixture, a cup of water, salt and sugar to taste. Adjust spice if needed( more black pepper for added authentic saoji taste)
recipeInstructions.name: In the pan, add butter and the blended mixture, a cup of water, salt and sugar to taste. Adjust spice if needed( more black pepper for added authentic saoji taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the Tempeh and cook on low heat covered for 20-30 minutes until the curry thickens and the tempeh is cooked and double in size.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the Tempeh and cook on low heat covered for 20-30 minutes until the curry thickens and the tempeh is cooked and double in size.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with any Indian flat bread(Roti, Paratha, Naan) or with Basmati Rice!.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot topped with any Indian flat bread(Roti, Paratha, Naan) or with Basmati Rice!.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep a pitcher of cold water at hand for the spice shock!!
